G4484-d-01-28-99-WC.Narrative: THE TRAIN TOPPED THE HILL AT MILEPOST 169 GOING APPROXIMATELY 20 MPH.  THE ENGINEER THEN SET AIR ATAPPROXIMATELY HWY. 13 AND IMMEDIATELY WENT AFTER MORE AIR AS HE ENTERED YARD LIMITS AND THE FIRST FEW APPLICATIONS DIDN'T SLOW THE TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER THEN PUT HIS TRAIN INTO FULL SERVICE AT THE CURVE AS HE COULDN'T SEE WHAT WAS AROUND IT.  WHEN THE TRAIN SPEED DID NOT REDUCE, HE PUT HIS TRAIN INTOEMERGENCY AND CONTINUED DOWNHILL WITH NO REDUCTION IN SPEED.  IT WAS THIS TIME THAT THE CREW NOTICED THE UNOCCUIPED STANDING TRAIN AHEAD.  TRAIN LO12-28 WAS STANDING IN THE PRENTICE YARD WAITING FORTHE CREW TO REPORT FOR DUTY.  THE CREW ON OSTES-27 THOUGHT THAT THEY WOULD STOP BEFORE IMPACTING WITH THE STANDING TRAIN BUT DIDN'T.  THEIR TRAIN HAD SLOWED TO APPROXIMATELY 11 MPH BEFORE THE IMPACT.THE ENGINEER ON OSTES-27 SHOULD HAVE SET HIS BRAKES EARLIER DUE TO THE SNOW & ICE CONDITIONS.  DUETO THIS FAILURE AN IMPACT OCCURRED RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO 2 CARS ON TRAIN OSTES-27, THE DERAILMENT OF 4 CARS AND DAMAGE TO 11 CARS ON LO12-28 (STANDING TRAIN).NoneNoneNoneNone

99006-d-01-28-99-TM.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
99006-d-01-28-99-TM.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
99006-d-01-28-99-TM.Narrative: TSE 2330 CREW WERE PULLING 56 CARS WITH 3 ENGINES NORTH FROM THE INTERNATIONAL RAILROAD BRIDGE FROMMEXICO.  THE FIRST 20 CARS WERE PULLED INTO TRACK 1 AND THE SECOND 20 INTO TRACK 2.  THE REMAINING 15 CARS WERE GOING INTO TRACK 3 WHEN THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT THERE WERE MANY MORE CARS.  HE STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND WENT TO INQUIRE AT THE BRIDGE OFFICE.  MEXICO HAD REVISED THE INTERCHANGE LIST FROM 56 CARS TO 72 CARS.  CONDUCTOR THEN CUT  WHAT HE THOUGHT WOULD FIT IN TRACK 4.  HOWEVER THE CARSLEFT IN TRACK 3 REMAINED FOULING TRACK 4.  CREW ON NORTH END  CUT 10 CARS FROM THE ENGINE AND PROCEEDED TO SHOVE SOUTH ON TRACK 4.   CREW HELPER WAS RIDING POINT OF THE 10 SHOVING CARS BUT GOT OFF ATSTREET CROSSING TO FLAG.  HE RADIOED TO CONDUCTOR THAT THE CARS WERE GOING HIS WAY.  THE CONDUCTOR ACKNOWLEDGE BUT WAS AT THE BRIDGE OFFICE OBTAINING THE REVISED INTERCHANGE LIST.  THE CONDUCTOR BEGANTO WALK TOWARDS THE SOUTH END SWITCH OF TRACK 4.  THE LEADING CAR OF THE SHOVING MOVEMENT, TM 1624,SIDE SWIPED  TM 1642 WHICH WAS ON TRACK 3.  TM 1642 WAS THEN LIFTED UP AND PUSHED INTO UTLX 643625WHICH WAS ON TRACK 2.  A FOURTH CAR DERAILED, TM 6054, WHICH WAS THE SECOND CAR ON THE SHOVING MOVEMENT AND WAS COUPLED UP TO TM1624.  ALL FOUR CARS WERE EMPTIES.NoneNone
